instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ,battery "X" not being detected, not the simple cases usually encountered
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ,battery "X" not being detected, not the simple cases usually encountered

Hi guys,having a strange <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board giving me headache.

problem is battery not being detected, thought should be a piece of cake as fixed a lot previously already.
usually only 3 things , which all had been checked in this case.


so here is the details,

problem is on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> which only has 2.5v, thought would be either isl , bill connector or smc pulling the voltage down.

I check the ground resistance on pin1 of <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> before I did any replacements, so pin 1 <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> is 610 , pin 1 on <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> is 497

good board would have 400 something on both

I already thought it strange at that point, since usually the ground resistance would be pulled down, not higher



so what happened next was, SMC, ISL both got replaced. bill connector removed. <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> replaced. <CAPACITOR>C6952</CAPACITOR> replaced.

then same result. same ground resistance, same 2.5v (roughly)


so really have no idea what it can be, i checked the trace too, but they don't seem to be broken

any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ,battery "X" not being detected, not the simple cases usually encountered
threads.message:
Resistance of <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>/81 in Ohms? Are your ground resistance measurements in Diode mode or in Ohms?

Tried a known good battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ,battery "X" not being detected, not the simple cases usually encountered
threads.message: Check your smbus data lines with an oscilloscope. Your multimeter is to slow see if your data line is communicating with pulses.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ,battery "X" not being detected, not the simple cases usually encountered
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ,battery "X" not being detected, not the simple cases usually encountered
threads.message: One last possible option is corrosion in/under the battery connector or another bad SMC. <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>/81 checked too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ,battery "X" not being detected, not the simple cases usually encountered
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> were checked. don't see anything on the connector.  but even I removed the SMC, the diode mode to ground resistance is still not right .

still 600+ on  <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL>  

normal should be 400+
